document.heading: Historic Motor Vehicle Vintage License Plate Amendment Act of 1998

history.narrative: Law 12-184, the “Historic Motor Vehicle Vintage License Plate Amendment Act of 1998,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 12-8, which was referred to the Committee on Public Works and the Environment. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on July 7, 1998, and September 22, 1998, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on October 2, 1998, it was assigned Act No. 12-455 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 12-184 became effective on March 26, 1999.

meta.search-text: ENROLLMENT(S) kwikta 089 897 555 5 COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA NOTICE D.C. LAW 12-184 "Historic Motor Vehicle Vintage License Plate Amendment Act of 1998" Pursuant to Section 412 of the District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, P.L. 93-198 "the Act the Council of the District of Columbia adopted Bill No. 12-8, on first and second readings, July 7, 1998 and September 22, 1998, respectively. Following the signature of the Mayor on October 2, 1998, pursuant to Section 404(e) of"the Act and was assigned Act No. 12-455 and published in the November 6, 1998, edition of the D.C. Register (Vol. 45 page 7796) and transmitted to Congress on January 25, 1999 for a 30-day review, in accordance with Section 602(c)(1) of the Act. The Council of the District of Columbia hereby gives notice that the 30-day Congressional Review Period has expired, and therefore, cites this enactment as D.C. Law 12-184, effective March 26, 1999. LINDA W CROPP Chairman of the Council Dates Counted During the 30-day Congressional Review Period: Feb. 2,3,4,8,9,10,11,12,22,23,24,25 Mar. 1,2,3,4,5,8,9,10,11,15,16,17,18,19,22,23,24,25 ENROLLED ORIGINAL AN ACT D.C, ACT 12-455 IN TI COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA OCTOBER 2, 1998 To amend the Compulsory/No-Fault Motor Vehicle Insurance Act of 1982 and the District of Columbia Revenue Act of 1937 to require owners to register and maintain insurance on vehicles being restored or repaired and to allow historic motor vehicle owners to use vintage District of Columbia license plates in place of historic motor vehicle license plates. Codification District of Columbia Code 1999 Supp. BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Historic Motor Vehicle Vintage License Plate Amendment Act of 1998 Sec. 2. Section 3(17) of the Compulsory/No-Fault Motor Vehicle Insurance Act of 1982, effective September 18, 1982 (D.C. Law 4-155; D.C. Code § 35-2102(17 is amended by striking the phrase "steam in the first sentence and inserting in its place the phrase "steam, including any non-operational vehicle that is being restored or repaired Sec. 3. The District of Columbia Revenue Act of 1937, approved August 17, 1937 (50 Stat. 679; D.C. Code § 40-101 et seq is amended as follows a) Section (1 D.C. Code § 40-101(1 is amended in the first sentence by striking the phrase "steam and inserting in its place the phrase "steam, including any non-operational vehicle that is being restored or repaired b) Section 2(d D.C. Code § 40-102(d is amended by adding a new paragraph (2A) to read as follows 2A) The Mayor, through the issuance of rules, shall permit the use of vintage license plates on historic motor vehicles in place of historic motor vehicle license plates, provided that the plate is legible and corresponds to the year of the vehicle’s make. The owner, through approval and registration of the vintage license plates, shall have the same fights, privileges, and obligations as if he or she had purchased new historic motor vehicle license plates. The rules promulgated pursuant to this paragraph, shall be issued no later than 90 days from the effective date of the Historic Motor Vehicle Vintage License Plate Amendment Act of 1998. The Mayor Section 35-2102 Section 41-101 Section 41-102 ENROLLED ORIGINAL may impose a reasonable fee to carry out the provisions of this paragraph Sec. 4. This act shall have no fiscal impact. Sec. 5. This act shall take effect following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council to override the veto approval by the Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Authority as provided in section 203(a) of the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995, approved April 17, 1995 (109 Stat. 116; D.C. Code § 47-392.3(a a 30-day period of Congressional review as provided in section 602(c)(1) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 813; D.C. Code § 1-233(c)(1 and publication in the District of Columbia Register.
